header: And There Will Be False Teachers Among You, Exploiting You

verse: But false-prophets also came among the people, as there will also be false-teachers among you who will secretly-bring-in heresies of  destruction— even denying the Master having bought them, bringing swift destruction upon themselves.
And many will follow-after their sensualities, because of whom the way of the truth will be blasphemed.
And in greed they will exploit you with fabricated words, for whom the judgment from-long-ago is not idle, and their destruction is not asleep.

header: God Will Reserve Them For Punishment And Protect The Righteous

verse: For if God did not spare angels having sinned but handed-them-over to chains of gloom, having cast-them-into-hell, being reserved for judgment;
and He did not spare the ancient world but protected the eighth one, Noah, a proclaimer of righteousness, having brought a flood upon the world of ungodly ones;
and He condemned the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah, having reduced-them-to-ashes by an overthrow, having made them an example of things coming to ungodly ones;
and He delivered Lot, a righteous one being oppressed by the conduct of the lawless ones in connection with sensuality
(for by sight and hearing the righteous one dwelling among them day after day was tormenting his righteous soul with their lawless works)—
then the Lord knows-how to deliver godly ones from a trial and reserve unrighteous ones for the day of judgment while being punished,
and especially the ones proceeding after the flesh in a lust for defilement, and despising authority.

header: They Are Self-Willed Slaves of Corruption Speaking Against The Things of God

verse: where angels being greater in strength and power do not bring a blasphemous judgment against them from the Lord.

But these ones are like unreasoning animals having been born as creatures-of-instinct for capture and destruction. While blaspheming in things which they are ignorant, they will also be destroyed in their destruction,
being wronged as the wages of wrong-doing. Regarding the reveling during the day to be a pleasure, they are spots and blemishes reveling in their deceptions while feasting-with you,
having eyes full of an adulteress and restless of sin, enticing unstable souls, having a heart trained in greed. Children of  a curse!—
leaving-behind the straight way, they went-astray, having followed-after the way of Balaam the son of Bosor, who loved the wages of wrong-doing.
But he had a rebuke of his own law-violation: a speechless donkey having uttered in the voice of a human restrained the madness of the prophet.
These ones are waterless springs, and mists being driven by a storm, for whom the gloom of the darkness has been reserved.
For while uttering pompous words of  futility, they entice by the desires of the flesh, by sensualities, the ones barely escaping-from the ones living in error,
promising them freedom, themselves being slaves of corruption. For by what one has been defeated, by this he has been enslaved.

header: Their Slavery Now Is Worse Than Ever

verse: For if— having escaped-from the defilements of the world by the knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, and again having been entangled by these things— they are defeated, then the last state has become worse for them than the first.
For it would be better for them not to have known the way of righteousness than having known, to turn-back from the holy commandment having been delivered to them.
The thing of the true proverb has happened to them— “The dog having returned to its own vomit”, and, “The sow having washed herself returns to a wallowing of the mire”.
